column1: Uin was a great whales in the service of Ulmo
column2: who used to drag Tol Eressëa towards Valinor in the earlier versions of the legendarium. Uin also pulled Ulmos fishy cart
column4: and is said to be the "primeval whale".
column5: p. 97 Uin does not appear in any later version of the legendarium
column6: and his role seems to have been merged with Ulmo himself.

column2: the word uin means "whale". The original meaning of uin seems to have been "wave". Another Gnomish word for whale was uimoth

column1: File:Alan Lee - Uin.jpg for Tales from the Perilous Realm
Uin is a character in Tolkiens Roverandom. In the story
column3: the great whale Uin takes the enchanted dog Rover (formerly known as Rover) to and from the Deep Blue Sea to visit the wizard Artaxerxes. Whilst staying with the mer-people
column4: Uin takes Roverandom on adventures through the seas: Uin takes Roverandom through the Shadowy Seas to the Bay of Eldamar beyond the Enchanted Isles where Rover saw the Pelóri and the light of Faery. Roverandom thought he could see the white glint of Tirion.
